issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: TestPerfCliDriver throws warning in StatsSetupConst that  JsonParser cannot parse COLUMN_STATS

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

We can keep default value as false, but we should turn it on for testing in {{data/conf/hive-site.xml}} and {{data/conf/tez/hive-site.xml}} so that we get coverage for this rule.

[~ashutoshc], got it... I need to go through q file changes then, as there are some tests that will need to be modified: they were written without taking this into account, and now a filter expression might be removed and the feature they are supposed to test would be untested...

I could do that, or maybe I could set the flag to true only for TestPerfCliDriver, what do you think? I think that could give us enough coverage.
I would need to double check the actual coverage that we would get, as with this patch, CBO was not executed for TestPerfDriver due to missing stats...
That makes sense. We can just turn it on for {{/data/conf/perf-reg/hive-site.xml}}
